Jun 2022 Family As beautiful and healing this trip as it was fifteen years ago when I first went. Absolutely unforgettable. It doesn't matter what you believe in, you will heal -- you will also meet new people and learn new things. The tour is entirely authentic and culturally rich. Most tours here are seriously colonized and only care about money and picture spots with no respect to the native land. Sedona has been colonized HARD in the past few decades-- golf courses everywhere, corporations popping up, resorts making their home on sacred ground-- but despite all that, we were able to access and learn about the more hidden wonders of the land. I personally hate feeling like a tourist (I don't speak for anyone else of course). On this trip Rahilio worked tirelessly to connect us with the land. I'm not quick to friendliness either-- I'm sort of cynical-- but the energy of the group was so instantly like family that we talked like we knew each other for years. Everything was beautiful and I genuinely felt grateful to be there for those few hours. Do NOT miss this tour.
